definition: to condescend/to deign
surname Qu
bent/to feel wronged
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
to condescend/condescending/patronizing

sentences.english: Your condescension, as always, is much appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一样，你的屈尊俯就总是让人感激。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith sometimes condescends to help his wife with the housework.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生有时屈尊帮他的媳妇做家务。

sentences.english: He doesn't deign to talk to unimportant people like me.
sentences.chinese: 他不肯屈尊和像我这样不重要的人说话。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith sometimes condescends to help his wife with the housework.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生有时屈尊帮他的妻子做家务。

sentences.english: He deign'd not to belie his soul in songs.
sentences.chinese: 他未屈尊吟唱，示灵魂以假象。

sentences.english: I think you may deign to marry me. I don't want to be an Adonis.
sentences.chinese: 你要屈尊下嫁，我可不想当小白脸儿。

sentences.english: Why? Because it  condescends toward the past.
sentences.chinese: 为什么？，因为它屈尊于历史。

sentences.english: We condescend if we speak of it as a phenomenon of the poor.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们说这是贫穷的现象那是我们屈尊了。

sentences.english: Reg walks a bit steady these days, sometimes with a bit of a stoop.
sentences.chinese: 注册走位稳定的这些天，有时有点屈尊。

sentences.english: We had to wait almost an hour before he condescended to see us.
sentences.chinese: 我们等了几乎一小时他才屈尊大驾来见我们。

sentences.english: The general condescended to eat with the soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 这位将军屈尊与士兵一同进餐。

sentences.english: Hermione did not deign to respond, but approached Harry.
sentences.chinese: 赫敏没有屈尊回答，而是走向了哈利。

sentences.english: BANKERS, erstwhile masters of the financial universe, are not used to being spoken down to.
sentences.chinese: 银行家，过去金融世界的主宰，还不习惯屈尊降贵。

sentences.english: Yeltsin was polite and friendly, but slightly patronizing.
sentences.chinese: 叶利钦很客气，很友好，稍微有点屈尊俯就的架势。

sentences.english: "You want to look out for them things, " said the officer on the left, condescendingly.
sentences.chinese: “你要当心这些转弯的地方，”左边的警察屈尊地说。

sentences.english: You should never condescend or look down on a co-worker.
sentences.chinese: 你永远也不应该瞧不起或以屈尊的态度对待同事。

definition: to get off one's high horse (idiom)/to dispense with posturing (and adopt a more humble or empathetic attitude)
servile
imperial chariot/(fig.) emperor/(polite) you
to tackle a difficult job (idiom)/to do sth reluctantly
(polite) do me the honor
to put on airs/to assume great airs
to show respect for/to think highly of
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
we are honored by your presence
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
shameless
to do sb the honor (of attending etc)/to put in an appearance/to show up
to put on airs
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
how could one dare?/I don't deserve such praise
